New Records: Glenn Phillips became the first batter to score a century in World Cups while coming in to bat in the middle order.
Glenn Phillips joined former Kiwi skipper Brendon McCullum as the only two New Zealanders to hit a T20 World Cup hundred.
Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips smashed a century at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
Phillips took on the role of the aggressor as he was supported by Daryl Mitchell in the first half of the Kiwi innings.
Phillips was eventually dismissed by Lahiru Kumara, getting caught by Dasun Shanaka after slicing a short ball, only to chip it high towards long-off running in.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phillips' knock helped the Kiwis register 167/7 on the board after 20 overs against Sri Lanka in their Super-12 encounter at the SCG.
Others: Phillips smashed 10 boundaries and 4 sixes against the Sri Lankans as he pulled New Zealand back into the game.
